structMember.name: hopsFromSyncProvider
structMember.description:
The number of hops to reach the Synchronization Provider.
If the Node Group Member is a Synchronization Provider, the value is zero.

structMember.name: localState
structMember.description: The role and the state of the Node Group Member.

structMember.name: synchronizedTo
structMember.description:
The neighbor node, to which a Synchronization Receiver is synchronized.
The number is the Node Priority of the neighbor node. If the node is a Synchronization Provider, the attribute indicates the priority of this node.

structMember.name: syncProviderNodePriority
structMember.description: The node priority of the Synchronization Provider as given by the attribute syncNodePriority for that node. If the node is a Synchronization Provider, the attribute indicates the priority of this node.

structMember.name: syncProviderState
structMember.description:
The synchronization state of the Synchronization Provider.
This information applies to a Synchronization Receiver. If the node has the role of Synchronization Provider, the detailed information on the state is in the RadioEquipmentClock MO.
The synchronization state of the Synchronization Provider determines which services can be enabled on the node: Time-dependent services, Frequency-dependent services, or no services.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description: The administrative state of a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: The synchronization state of the Node Group Member is unknown.

enumMember.name: SYNC_PROVIDER
enumMember.description: The Node Group Member is a Synchronization Provider and is either locked to an external synchronization reference, or in holdover mode. The reference in use is indicated by currentRadioClockReference in the RadioEquipmentClock MO. The clock state is indicated by radioClockState in the RadioEquipmentClock MO.

enumMember.name: SYNC_RECEIVER_TIME_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The Node Group Member is a Synchronization Receiver that is radio-frame time-locked to another Node Group Member.

enumMember.name: SYNC_RECEIVER_TIME_HOLDOVER
enumMember.description: The Node Group Member is a Synchronization Receiver in time holdover state. Services are maintained.

enumMember.name: ENTERING_NODE_GROUP
enumMember.description: The Node Group Member is entering into a Node Group. The role in the Node Group is not yet defined.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: The synchronization status of the Radio Interface (RI) port is unknown.

enumMember.name: OK_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The Synchronization RI port is OK and is selected as active reference for the node.

enumMember.name: OK_NOT_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The Synchronization RI port is OK, but is not selected as active reference for the node.

enumMember.name: CPRI_LINK_NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: The RI port configured as synchronization candidate is not available for synchronization.

enumMember.name: FREQUENCY_ERROR
enumMember.description: The node cannot frequency-synchronize to the neighbor node connected to the RI port.

enumMember.name: PHASE_ERROR
enumMember.description: The node cannot phase-synchronize to the neighbor node connected to the RI port.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_FREQUENCY_MEASUREMENTS
enumMember.description: No measurements of frequency difference can be retrieved from the RI port.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_PHASE_MEASUREMENTS
enumMember.description: No measurements of phase difference can be retrieved from the RI port.

enumMember.name: FREQUENCY_LOCKING
enumMember.description: The Node Group Member is at the intermediate stage of frequency synchronization to the neighbor node connected to this RI port. The attribute syncRiPortStatus will be either OK_ACTIVE or OK_NOT_ACTIVE when frequency synchronization is successfully completed.

enumMember.name: CONNECTED_TO_RU_NOT_TO_NEIGHBOR
enumMember.description: Connection can be set up with shared RU, communication with neighbor not possible.

enumMember.name: NO_SYNC_COMMUNICATION
enumMember.description: Nodes are frequency aligned, there is no communication with neighbor.

enumMember.name: NODE_PRIORITY_COLLISION
enumMember.description: Same syncNodePriority used in two or more nodes.

enumMember.name: SELECTION_MODE_MISMATCH
enumMember.description: RI port disqualified due to selection mode mismatch.

enum.name: SelectionMode
enum.description: Specifies selection mode of node group sync member.

enumMember.name: NODE_PRIORITY
enumMember.description: Selection based on syncNodePriority value.

enumMember.name: REFERENCE_AND_NODE_PRIORITY
enumMember.description: Selection based on best reference availability and syncNodePriority value.

enum.name: SyncProviderState
enum.description: The synchronization state of the Synchronization Provider.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: The synchronization state of the Synchronization Provider is unknown, or no Synchronization Provider is reported within the Node Group.

enumMember.name: TIME_MODE
enumMember.description: The Synchronization Provider is operating in time-providing mode.

enumMember.name: FREQUENCY_MODE
enumMember.description: The Synchronization Provider is operating in frequency-providing mode.

enumMember.name: FREE_RUNNING
enumMember.description: The Synchronization Provider has lost all external references and the frequency holdover period has expired. No other node has managed to take over the role of Synchronization Provider.

class.name: NodeGroupSyncMember
class.description:
A Node Group is a group of Ericsson RBS nodes that must be radio-frame synchronized to each other.
The MO is created for each member of the Node Group. Each Node Group uses only one external synchronization reference. The node that uses the external synchronization reference is called the Synchronization Provider. The other nodes in the Node Group are called Synchronization Receivers. All Synchronization Receivers synchronize their radio-frame to the Synchronization Provider, either directly or to another Synchronization Receiver.

action.name: retryEntranceToNodeGroup
action.description: Retries entrance to the Node Group. Can be used if the automatic entrance to the Node Group has failed.
action.disturbances: This action might cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: localNodeInformation
attribute.description: Synchronization information on the Node Group Member itself.

attribute.name: nodeGroupSyncMemberId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: selectionMode
attribute.description: Role selection mode of node group member.

attribute.name: syncNodePriority
attribute.description: This number is used both as a way to identify a Node Group Member, and to give the node a priority value which is used when selecting the Synchronization Provider. Every Node Group Member must have a unique number. The value 1 has the highest priority.

attribute.name: syncProviderInformation
attribute.description: Provides information on the Synchronization Provider, that is the Node Group Member that is synchronizing to a reference external to the Node Group.

attribute.name: syncRiPortCandidate
attribute.description: Reference list of RiPort MOs that are candidates to be used as synchronization reference for all nodes. For NGS startup procedure RiPort MO must be set as syncRiPortCandidate only when it is connected to other nodes in NGS, otherwise node startup is prolonged to its maximum value.

attribute.name: syncRiPortStatus
attribute.description:
The status of the Radio Interface (RI) ports configured as candidates for Node Group synchronization.
The order of the Synchronization RI Ports is the same as for syncRiPortCandidate.
